narration: Welcome to this presentation on recycling.  We'll explore why recycling is so important and how we can all contribute to a more sustainable future.

title: Why Recycle?
content:
Conserves Natural Resources
Reduces Landfill Waste
Saves Energy
Protects Wildlife and Habitats
Creates Jobs
image_desc:
A photo showing a lush forest contrasted with a overflowing landfill. Type: photograph

### Video Suggestion:
[Optional: No video suggestion needed]
narration: Recycling is crucial for several reasons. It conserves natural resources reducing the need to extract new materials.  It significantly reduces the amount of waste ending up in landfills protecting our environment.  Recycling also saves energy compared to producing new materials from raw resources. This helps protect wildlife and their habitats. Finally the recycling industry creates jobs and supports local economies.

title: How to Recycle Effectively
content:
**Column 1:  Before Recycling**
Rinse containers thoroughly.
Remove lids and caps.
Separate different materials.
Check local recycling guidelines.
**Column 2:  What to Recycle**
Paper
Cardboard
Plastic bottles and jugs
Aluminum cans
Glass bottles and jars
image_desc:
A diagram showing the steps involved in properly preparing recyclable materials for collection. Type: diagram

### Video Suggestion:
[Optional: No video suggestion needed]
narration: To recycle effectively remember to rinse containers before discarding them.  Remove lids and caps and separate different materials like paper plastic and metal.  It's also important to check your local recycling guidelines as regulations can vary.  Commonly recycled items include paper cardboard plastic bottles and jugs aluminum cans and glass bottles and jars.
